title: 2 Timothy 1:1
content: 1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, according to the promise of the life which is in Christ Jesus,

title: 2 Timothy 1:2
content: 2 to Timothy, my beloved child: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

title: 2 Timothy 1:3
content: 3 I thank God, whom I serve as my forefathers did, with a pure conscience. How unceasing is my memory of you in my petitions, night and day

title: 2 Timothy 1:4
content: 4 longing to see you, remembering your tears, that I may be filled with joy;

title: 2 Timothy 1:5
content: 5 having been reminded of the sincere faith that is in you, which lived first in your grandmother Lois and your mother Eunice and, I am persuaded, in you also.

title: 2 Timothy 1:6
content: 6 For this cause, I remind you that you should stir up the gift of God which is in you through the laying on of my hands.

title: 2 Timothy 1:7
content: 7 For God didn’t give us a spirit of fear, but of power, love, and self-control.

title: 2 Timothy 1:8
content: 8 Therefore don’t be ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner; but endure hardship for the Good News according to the power of God,

title: 2 Timothy 1:9
content: 9 who saved us and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given to us in Christ Jesus before times eternal,

title: 2 Timothy 1:10
content: 10 but has now been revealed by the appearing of our Savior, Christ Jesus, who abolished death, and brought life and immortality to light through the Good News.

title: 2 Timothy 1:11
content: 11 For this I was appointed as a preacher, an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.

title: 2 Timothy 1:12
content: 12 For this cause I also suffer these things. Yet I am not ashamed, for I know him whom I have believed, and I am persuaded that he is able to guard that which I have committed to him against that day.

title: 2 Timothy 1:13
content: 13 Hold the pattern of sound words which you have heard from me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

title: 2 Timothy 1:14
content: 14 That good thing which was committed to you, guard through the Holy Spirit who dwells in us.

title: 2 Timothy 1:15
content: 15 This you know, that all who are in Asia turned away from me, of whom are Phygelus and Hermogenes.

title: 2 Timothy 1:16
content: 16 May the Lord grant mercy to the house of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain,

title: 2 Timothy 1:17
content: 17 but when he was in Rome, he sought me diligently and found me

title: 2 Timothy 1:18
content: 18 (the Lord grant to him to find the Lord’s mercy in that day); and in how many things he served at Ephesus, you know very well.

title: 2 Timothy 2:1
content: 1 You therefore, my child, be strengthened in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

title: 2 Timothy 2:2
content: 2 The things which you have heard from me among many witnesses, commit the same things to faithful men who will be able to teach others also.

title: 2 Timothy 2:3
content: 3 You therefore must endure hardship as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.

title: 2 Timothy 2:4
content: 4 No soldier on duty entangles himself in the affairs of life, that he may please him who enrolled him as a soldier.

title: 2 Timothy 2:5
content: 5 Also, if anyone competes in athletics, he isn’t crowned unless he has competed by the rules.

title: 2 Timothy 2:6
content: 6 The farmer who labors must be the first to get a share of the crops.

title: 2 Timothy 2:7
content: 7 Consider what I say, and may the Lord give you understanding in all things.

title: 2 Timothy 2:8
content: 8 Remember Jesus Christ, risen from the dead, of the offspring of David, according to my Good News,

title: 2 Timothy 2:9
content: 9 in which I suffer hardship to the point of chains as a criminal. But God’s word isn’t chained.

title: 2 Timothy 2:10
content: 10 Therefore I endure all things for the chosen ones’ sake, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

title: 2 Timothy 2:11
content: 11 This saying is trustworthy: “For if we died with him, we will also live with him.

title: 2 Timothy 2:12
content: 12 If we endure, we will also reign with him. If we deny him, he also will deny us.

title: 2 Timothy 2:13
content: 13 If we are faithless, he remains faithful; for he can’t deny himself.”

title: 2 Timothy 2:14
content: 14 Remind them of these things, charging them in the sight of the Lord that they don’t argue about words to no profit, to the subverting of those who hear.

title: 2 Timothy 2:15
content: 15 Give diligence to present yourself approved by God, a workman who doesn’t need to be ashamed, properly handling the Word of Truth.

title: 2 Timothy 2:16
content: 16 But shun empty chatter, for it will go further in ungodliness,

title: 2 Timothy 2:17
content: 17 and those words will consume like gangrene, of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus:

title: 2 Timothy 2:18
content: 18 men who have erred concerning the truth, saying that the resurrection is already past, and overthrowing the faith of some.

title: 2 Timothy 2:19
content: 19 However, God’s firm foundation stands, having this seal: “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Let every one who names the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness.”

title: 2 Timothy 2:20
content: 20 Now in a large house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of clay. Some are for honor and some for dishonor.

title: 2 Timothy 2:21
content: 21 If anyone therefore purges himself from these, he will be a vessel for honor, sanctified, and suitable for the master’s use, prepared for every good work.

title: 2 Timothy 2:22
content: 22 Flee from youthful lusts; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

title: 2 Timothy 2:23
content: 23 But refuse foolish and ignorant questionings, knowing that they generate strife.

title: 2 Timothy 2:24
content: 24 The Lord’s servant must not quarrel, but be gentle toward all, able to teach, patient,

title: 2 Timothy 2:25
content: 25 in gentleness correcting those who oppose him. Perhaps God may give them repentance leading to a full knowledge of the truth,

title: 2 Timothy 2:26
content: 26 and they may recover themselves out of the devil’s snare, having been taken captive by him to do his will.

title: 2 Timothy 3:1
content: 1 But know this: that in the last days, grievous times will come.

title: 2 Timothy 3:2
content: 2 For men will be lovers of self, lovers of money, boastful, arrogant, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,

title: 2 Timothy 3:3
content: 3 without natural affection, unforgiving, slanderers, without self-control, fierce, not lovers of good,

title: 2 Timothy 3:4
content: 4 traitors, headstrong, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God,

title: 2 Timothy 3:5
content: 5 holding a form of godliness but having denied its power. Turn away from these, also.

title: 2 Timothy 3:6
content: 6 For some of these are people who creep into houses and take captive gullible women loaded down with sins, led away by various lusts,

title: 2 Timothy 3:7
content: 7 always learning and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.

title: 2 Timothy 3:8
content: 8 Even as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so these also oppose the truth, men corrupted in mind, who concerning the faith are rejected.

title: 2 Timothy 3:9
content: 9 But they will proceed no further. For their folly will be evident to all men, as theirs also came to be.

title: 2 Timothy 3:10
content: 10 But you followed my teaching, conduct, purpose, faith, patience, love, steadfastness,

title: 2 Timothy 3:11
content: 11 persecutions, and sufferings—those things that happened to me at Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra. I endured those persecutions. The Lord delivered me out of them all.

title: 2 Timothy 3:12
content: 12 Yes, and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution.

title: 2 Timothy 3:13
content: 13 But evil men and impostors will grow worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.

title: 2 Timothy 3:14
content: 14 But you remain in the things which you have learned and have been assured of, knowing from whom you have learned them.

title: 2 Timothy 3:15
content: 15 From infancy, you have known the holy Scriptures which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.

title: 2 Timothy 3:16
content: 16 Every Scripture is God-breathed and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for instruction in righteousness,

title: 2 Timothy 3:17
content: 17 that each person who belongs to God may be complete, thoroughly equipped for every good work.

title: 2 Timothy 4:1
content: 1 I command you therefore before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, who will judge the living and the dead at his appearing and his Kingdom:

title: 2 Timothy 4:2
content: 2 preach the word; be urgent in season and out of season; reprove, rebuke, and exhort with all patience and teaching.

title: 2 Timothy 4:3
content: 3 For the time will come when they will not listen to the sound doctrine, but having itching ears, will heap up for themselves teachers after their own lusts,

title: 2 Timothy 4:4
content: 4 and will turn away their ears from the truth, and turn away to fables.

title: 2 Timothy 4:5
content: 5 But you be sober in all things, suffer hardship, do the work of an evangelist, and fulfill your ministry.

title: 2 Timothy 4:6
content: 6 For I am already being offered, and the time of my departure has come.

title: 2 Timothy 4:7
content: 7 I have fought the good fight. I have finished the course. I have kept the faith.

title: 2 Timothy 4:8
content: 8 From now on, the crown of righteousness is stored up for me, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will give to me on that day; and not to me only, but also to all those who have loved his appearing.

title: 2 Timothy 4:9
content: 9 Be diligent to come to me soon,

title: 2 Timothy 4:10
content: 10 for Demas left me, having loved this present world, and went to Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia; and Titus to Dalmatia.

title: 2 Timothy 4:11
content: 11 Only Luke is with me. Take Mark and bring him with you, for he is useful to me for service.

title: 2 Timothy 4:12
content: 12 But I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.

title: 2 Timothy 4:13
content: 13 Bring the cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus when you come—and the books, especially the parchments.

title: 2 Timothy 4:14
content: 14 Alexander the coppersmith did much evil to me. The Lord will repay him according to his deeds.

title: 2 Timothy 4:15
content: 15 Beware of him, for he greatly opposed our words.

title: 2 Timothy 4:16
content: 16 At my first defense, no one came to help me, but all left me. May it not be held against them.

title: 2 Timothy 4:17
content: 17 But the Lord stood by me and strengthened me, that through me the message might be fully proclaimed, and that all the Gentiles might hear. So I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

title: 2 Timothy 4:18
content: 18 And the Lord will deliver me from every evil work and will preserve me for his heavenly Kingdom. To him be the glory forever and ever. Amen.

title: 2 Timothy 4:19
content: 19 Greet Prisca and Aquila, and the house of Onesiphorus.

title: 2 Timothy 4:20
content: 20 Erastus remained at Corinth, but I left Trophimus at Miletus sick.

title: 2 Timothy 4:21
content: 21 Be diligent to come before winter. Eubulus salutes you, as do Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers.

title: 2 Timothy 4:22
content: 22 The Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
